Key Findings

  • The total spend analysed across 2 financial years is £12.0M across 3,767 transactions.
  • Ribble Valley Borough Council's spending increased by £2.8M from 2024 to 2025.
  • The overall change in spending from 2024 to 2025 is an increase of 61.9%.

Introduction to Ribble Valley Spending

Ribble Valley Borough Council's spending data, covering the financial years 2024/25 to 2025/26, reveals a significant increase in expenditure. The total spend for these two years is £12.0M, with 3,767 transactions recorded. This data provides valuable insights into the council's financial activities and trends.

The spending increase from £4.6M in 2024 to £7.4M in 2025 is notable, with a 61.9% rise in just one year. This change may indicate a shift in the council's priorities or a response to emerging needs within the community.

It is essential to analyse this data in context, considering the council's responsibilities and the services it provides to the community. By examining the spending trends and patterns, we can gain a better understanding of the council's financial management and decision-making processes.

Year-by-Year Spending Trends

A closer look at the year-by-year spending trends reveals a substantial increase in expenditure from 2024 to 2025. The spending rose from £4.6M to £7.4M, representing a 61.9% increase. This significant rise may be attributed to various factors, including changes in government policies, demographic shifts, or new initiatives implemented by the council.

To better understand the spending trends, it is crucial to consider the council's budget allocation and how it has evolved over time. Although the data does not provide a detailed breakdown of the spending by department, it is clear that the overall expenditure has increased substantially.

Conclusion and Implications

The spending data for Ribble Valley Borough Council highlights a significant increase in expenditure from 2024 to 2025. The 61.9% rise in spending is a notable trend that warrants further investigation. By analysing this data, we can identify areas where the council may be allocating more resources and priorities.

It is essential for the community to be aware of the council's spending trends and to engage with the decision-making processes. By doing so, residents can ensure that the council's priorities align with their needs and expectations.

What You Can Do

  • Submit a Freedom of Information request to Ribble Valley Borough Council about their budget allocation and spending priorities.
  • Attend council committee meetings, which are open to the public, to stay informed about the council's decision-making processes.
  • Check the council's published contracts register to gain insight into their procurement activities and supplier relationships.
  • Write to your local councillor about your concerns or questions regarding the council's spending trends and priorities.
  • Visit aidoge.co.uk to explore the full spending data and analyse the trends in more detail.
This article is based on Ribble Valley Borough Council's published spending data covering 2024/25 to 2025/26. All figures are drawn directly from transactions published under the Local Government Transparency Code. Analysis by AI DOGE.
